intro: Acer orientale, commonly known as the oriental maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, red flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and parks.
